title: Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail: Things To Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do       The Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail is a diverse network of trails and routes embracing portions of five geographic provinces and two major watersheds. The "Things to Do" section includes more information and additional links to explore the Trail network, and a KMZ file that is available for download, provides a window into the Trail network through Google Earth.          Sunrise along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Photo Credit: Thomas Mann  Explore the Trail Network by Region This is a great place to start if you are unfamiliar with the Trail or are looking to explore specific areas of the Trail.          Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail in Washington, D.C. Photo Credit: Thomas Mann  Explore Segments of the Trail Network Discover the individual Trail segments that make up the length of the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail.          Fourth graders participate in the Every Kid in a Park initiative on the C&O Canal Photo Credit: NPS/Stromberg  Family Friendly & Kid Activities This is the best place to start planning your next trip if you are looking for some great family-friendly activities along the Potomac Heritage NST. From the Every Kid in a Park initiative to our Junior Ranger programs, there is something for everyone in your family.                A pair of hiking boots rests on a rock. Photo Credit: NPS/Zielinski  Hiking Hiking opportunities along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail are extensive and one of the best ways to experience the beauty, history and culture of the Trail network.         Biking is a popular way to experience the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Photo Credit: NPS/Guell  Bicycling  Learn about the bicycling opportunities available along the network.        Kayaks along the Potomac River Photo Credit: NPS  Paddling Paddle through history by way of the Trail corridor. Discover areas explored by American Indians, John Smith, and George Washington.        Winter along the C&O Canal Photo Credit: NPS/Lin  Cross-Country Skiing & Other Winter Activities The fun only increases once the snow falls along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail. With tons of miles of cross-country skiing along the Trail, enjoy popular Trail activities year-round!          Volunteers measure soil erosion along the Potomac River Photo Credit: NPS  Get Involved & Volunteer Opportunities Love the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail and want to help maintain it for the enjoyment of everyone? There are plenty of opportunities to volunteer with local groups and make a difference!
